p: NS2, also known as the nuclear export protein, transports newly synthesized RNPs out of the nucleus after amplification [ 58, 59]. Further, it has been suggested that NS2 is important for efficient influenza virion formation and budding due to its interactions with the F1Fo-ATPase [ 60]. The IAV virulence protein PB1-F2 contributes to inflammatory responses and flu-induced pathogenesis through activation of the NLRP3-inflammasome [ 61].
